item.title: Comment on Thursday assorted links by DRP
item.description:
7.

I've read this quote 5x and still have no idea what he's trying to say:

"We have it where you can get a 30-year mortgage in this country for a first-time homebuyer, but what happens when my six-year contract, when that comes to an end, and you say, I got automation taking your job—where does my mortgage go?”

Does he feel entitled to a guaranteed 6-figure job for 30 years?

item.title: Comment on Thursday assorted links by Martin Kennedy
item.description:
#7 ILA are probably much like the Teamsters, with whom I became well acquainted in my professional life. Any chucklehead who wants to about unions, ought first to work in a union environment, to see just how far the reality departs from the ideal.
Stupid, harmful rules that create inefficiency and plenty of members not so stupid that they can't leverage those myriad rules to the firm's disadvantage.
